intro: Galeandra blanchetii, commonly known as the white-flowered galeandra, is a species of orchid native to the high-altitude regions of Central America. It is characterized by its elegant, white flowers that bloom in late summer, adding a striking visual contrast to its green foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or forested habitats, preferring well-drained soil and partial shade. Its inflorescence consists of a single raceme bearing several showy flowers, each with a distinctive lip that aids in pollination. Galeandra blanchetii is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated by orchid enthusiasts for its beauty and rarity.
